plugins.name: Iconsynx
plugins.description:
ICONSYNX plugin converts SVG icons into WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot) with seamless React, Vue, and TypeScript integration. Easily generate custom icon fonts, automate GitHub PR creation, and streamline your workflow. Perfect for teams managing CSS-based icon fonts while working with modern JavaScript frameworks.


Privacy Note:

To enable GitHub PR automation, this plugin requires access to your GitHub repository via a personal access token (GitHub token). The token is used only for creating pull requests and is stored securely. No sensitive data is collected or shared.


üîπ Key Features:

‚úÖ Convert Figma SVGs to WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot)

‚úÖ One-click WebFont generation for seamless icon management

‚úÖ React & Vue support for easy integration in frontend projects

‚úÖ TypeScript compatibility for strongly-typed icon components

‚úÖ Automated GitHub PRs to update icon sets effortlessly

‚úÖ Optimized font bundles to reduce file size and improve performance
plugins.tagline: Convert SVG icons into WebFonts with GitHub PR automation & React, Vue, TypeScript support.

plugins.name: Fake Content Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Use AI and ChatGPT to make fake content for your designs.!


Fake Content Maker is a straight-forward Figma Plugin where you enter in your OpenAI key, and then can enter in a prompt to generate your own fake content.


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. Create your own OpenAI token so you pay only for what you use


üßê How it works:

  1. Open up Fake Content Maker, and enter in the kind of content you want to make / generate
  2. Enter in your OpenAI token so that you only pay for what you generate (around $0.01 for every 10 generations)

plugins.name: Variable Icons
plugins.description:
Convert selected SVG icons into components while assigning variables for streamlined design control.


Currently, the plugin supports only line icons using stroke color.


Benefits

  1. Centralized icon styling with variables and modes.
  2. Optimized icon components for instance swaps.
  3. Tailored for Lucide Icons.


Video Tutorial

Watch a quick demo to see the plugin in action.


Features

  1. Assigns variables to:
  2. Width and height of selected frames
  3. Stroke weight of the shapes of selected frames
  4. Stroke color of the shapes of selected frames
  5. Sets selected frames to auto-layout mode
  6. Positions the shapes of selected frames in absolute mode
  7. Converts selected frames into components
  8. Saves assigned variables as preferences within the plugin


Limitations

  1. Local Variables Only: The plugin supports only local variables. Shared library assets are not recognized, but local variables with alias values from remote libraries will work.
  2. Stroke Icons Only: Filled-style icons are not supported for stroke weight and stroke color variable assignments.
  3. Flattened Shapes Only: Icons containing ovals, rectangles, text, or groups will not have variables assigned.


Feedback

I‚Äôm a solo designer who learned coding with AI tools. This plugin has proved useful in my workflow, but I‚Äôm eager to hear how it fits into yours.

Comments and suggestions are welcome!

  1. Share your thoughts below
  2. Or email me: domas dot markevicius at me dot com
plugins.tagline: An easy way to convert SVG icons to components with variables.

plugins.name: Variables Everywhere
plugins.description:
Check your designs for missing variables on:

  3. dimensions (width & height)
  4. corner radius


How to use

  1. Select all frames you want to inspect
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Click on any found issue to select it on your artboard

Plugin Introduction

This plugin is a handy tool for aligning selected nodes in FigJam. It supports horizontal and vertical alignment, as well as custom grid alignment with a specified number of columns. Additionally, it allows you to adjust the spacing between nodes, making it easy to achieve efficient and visually consistent designs.


Key Features

  1. Horizontal Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single horizontal row.
  2. Vertical Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single vertical column.
  3. Custom Grid Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a grid with the specified number of columns.
  4. Spacing Adjustment: Allows you to freely adjust the spacing between nodes.


How to Use

  1. Select the nodes you want to align.
  2. Set the number of columns and the spacing in the plugin interface.
  3. Click or drag the Horizontal Alignment, Vertical Alignment, or the stepper.
  4. The nodes will be aligned according to the settings.
plugins.tagline: Multiple nodes can be easily aligned. The number of columns and spacing can also be easily set.

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Themes & Variables
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades ‚Äî instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup ‚Äî so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork ‚Äî Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


üöÄ How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click ‚ÄúGenerate Variables‚Äù
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


‚ú® Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token‚Äìfriendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy ‚Äî even at scale


‚öôÔ∏è How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable ‚Äî ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks ‚Äî no broken styles, no messy overrides.


üí¨ Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning ‚Äî future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

plugins.name: Zimmar - Accessibility Compliance Checker
plugins.description:
Zimmar is a free Figma plugin that checks for accessibility compliance issues and helps you fix them.


Many designers face challenges in spotting issues like small text, poor color contrast, or improperly spaced touch targets. I wanted to build a tool that would empower designers to spot and fix these issues right within Figma.


Zimmar is designed to seamlessly integrate with Figma and provide designers with quick, actionable insights.


Here‚Äôs how it helps:


  1. Scans your design for font size, contrast, and touch target issues.
  2. Flags areas where improvements are needed based on accessibility standards like WCAG.
  3. Provides suggestions to help you fix issues and improve your designs right away.
  4. Provides accessibility compliance overview on a single selection.
  5. Generates CSV or JSON reports of detected issues for further analysis.


This plugin isn‚Äôt just about checking boxes - it‚Äôs about raising awareness and making accessibility an integral part of the design process. By addressing these issues early, I strongly believe, we can create experiences that are truly inclusive and reach a wider audience.


Your comments and feedback are appreciated!
plugins.tagline: Scan your designs for font size, contrast, and touch target issues and resolve them instantly

plugins.name: Text Contrast
plugins.description:
The fastest contrast checker in the galaxy!‚Ä®


Text Contrast lets you instantly run a AA or AAA contrast report on all text across your selected mockups before you can blink.


Simply select a frames, groups, or components, and hit Check.

A detailed report will automatically display next to your artboard, giving you immediate feedback on color contrast compliance.


Hot Features:

  1. The plugin quickly calculates contrast ratios between text and its background, ensuring compliance with WCAG 2.2 standards.


  1. No need to be an expert, results appear instantly as a visual copy next to the original, with a focus on contrast and font size.


  1. The plugin won‚Äôt alter your design. Results are shown as an overlay, maintaining your original layout.


  1. Select your artboard, click "CHECK", and voil√†! Get immediate results without leaving your workflow.‚Ä®


How It Works:

  1. Easy Interaction: Select your artboard and click "CHECK." The plugin analyzes the contrast between the text color and its parent fill color.


  1. Focused Analysis: The calculation is based on the contrast ratio and font sizes, providing fast, accurate results for single color text layers.‚Ä®


Limitations:

  1. The plugin operates over frames, groups, and components but only supports one artboard at a time.


  1. It currently does not support gradients or mixed color/font size text layers.


This is my first plugin, so feel free to share any feedback ‚ô•Ô∏è
plugins.tagline: Figure out text contrast issues reported directly on the artboard.

plugins.name: Peppercorn - Find Centroids (Visual Center)
plugins.description:
Find the geometric center (centroid) of vector shapes.

This experimental plugin calculates the centroid to determine the center of shapes.

üëâ Usage

  1. Place your shape in a container for better experience
  2. Select the shape
  3. Run the plugin


‚ö†Ô∏è Note

  1. This plugin is experimental and may not work perfectly for all shapes
  2. The centroid method works best for simple and symmetrical shapes
  3. For complex or highly irregular shapes, the centroid may not always represent the visual center


üõ†Ô∏è Future Updates

  1. We plan to add visual guides to help you understand the centroid's position
  2. Considering additional methods like the smallest enclosing circle for more complex shapes

plugins.name: Name Slayer
plugins.description:
Slay your layer names

  1. Select layer(s) with styles or variables directly applied to them (color, text and effect).
  2. Preview how many layers will be renamed, already match their style/variable name, have no styles applied, or if part of your selection has more than one style/variable applied to the same layer.
  3. Click Rename layer!


This plugin is a great complement to Styler, when style names and layer names become out of sync.


Notes

  1. Name Slayer supports color variables and color styles applied to either a fill or stroke, as well as text styles and effect styles.
  2. Layers with more than one style or variable can‚Äôt be renamed ‚Äì layers must have a single style or variable to know what to rename it to.
  3. Styles which alias variables will be rename to the style, not the variable within.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Easily rename layers to match the name of their applied styles and variables.

plugins.name: Better Node Inspector
plugins.description:
Better Node Inspector by Dualite, offers a range of capabilities for examining node properties. The interface streamlines the process of inspecting node characteristics.


Users can access general properties, positional attributes, flex and auto-layout settings, fill properties, view child elements, and explore additional properties not covered in the main categories


Open-source repo: https://github.com/dualiteindia/better-node-inspector


  1. The plugin utilizes the async Figma API
  2. Node child elements are only loaded when the user clicks on the children dropdown, significantly enhancing plugin performance and making it super fast.


Usage

Simply select a node in your project, and Better Node Inspector will display its properties in an easy-to-navigate interface.

plugins.name: CoverCraft - Figma x Hashnode
plugins.description:
Are you creating cover images for your Hashnode Post ? Constantly downloading, naming, renaming files and switching platforms just to ensure your cover image looks perfect. We've been there, and we understand your frustration.


But fret not, because CoverCraft is here to save the day! Say goodbye to all the hassle and frustration. With CoverCraft, certainly no more platform switching.


Imagine being able to craft your cover images in Figma and seamlessly set them on your Hashnode blog posts with just a few clicks. That's the power of CoverCraft - simplifying your workflow and allowing you to focus on what truly matters: crafting your cover.


Features:


Firstly, To Unlock the full potential of CoverCraft you need access token. Don't have a token yet? No worries ‚Äì create access token


1) Set Cover Images:


  • While plugin is open, Select image or frame containing your cover image. Next, choose the post in which you want to set the selected image as the cover, currently we support published post.
  • Finally, Click Set as Cover to apply the selected image or frame as the cover for the chosen post.


2) Generate your Imagination:


  • We discovered that users often struggled with selecting the perfect background image. To address this, Introducing Lexica AI into plugin to Generate Images from Prompt. Search for Background Images based on your imagination.
  • Open plugin and run in file where you aim to build Cover Image.
  • Navigate to the Search Cover Tab, Enter your imaginative prompt to initiate the Search. Browse through the generated images and select the one that resonates with your vision.
  • Witness the magic by clicking on image and make your cover. Once your newly created cover image is ready, set without ever leaving Figma.


3) Dark and Light Mode Support:


  • Our plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma's preference theme, offering support for both dark and light modes. This means that regardless of your chosen theme in Figma, our plugin will automatically adjust its appearance to match.
  • This ensures a consistent and comfortable user experience. If preferred working theme is dark, our plugin will automatically detect and switch to dark mode. Conversely, if you opt for a light theme, the plugin will effortlessly transition to light mode.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Set Cover Images from Figma to Hashnode

plugins.name: Chameleon
plugins.description:
ü¶é CHAMELEON


Chameleon is a Figma plugin that turns color token management into a breeze. Build smart palettes, structure tokens, and export directly into native Figma Variables.



üé® KEY FEATURES


üé® Smart palette generation ‚Äî create harmonious color ramps from a single base color


üåí Auto dark theme ‚Äî instantly generate dark versions of your palettes


‚ôø A11Y mode ‚Äî contrast-optimized palettes that meet WCAG accessibility standards


üß∑ Figma Variables export ‚Äî full support for collections, modes, and cross-collection aliases


üì§ JSON import/export ‚Äî compatible with Figma Variables and Token Studio


‚úèÔ∏è Flexible structure ‚Äî rename shades, palettes, collections, and modes while preserving links



üåí AUTO DARK THEME


Instantly generate perceptually balanced dark palettes based on your light theme.


How it works:

  1. Inverts brightness scale: lightest shade (50) becomes darkest, darkest (900) becomes lightest
  2. Base color remains at position 500
  3. Brightness follows a perceptual (non-linear) scale
  4. Saturation is increased for dark shades, reduced for light ones
  5. Additional correction ensures visual harmony



üé® BASE MODE


Best for:

  1. Creating aesthetic palettes without strict contrast rules
  2. Branding and accent color systems
  3. Visually balanced UIs with emphasis on artistic control


Generation logic:

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50‚Äì400) and darker (600‚Äì900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



‚ôø A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ‚â• 1.3:1



üìå HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



‚öôÔ∏è UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light ‚Äî 95% ‚Üí 20%, Dark ‚Äî 15% ‚Üí 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (‚òÖ)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



üöß STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.
plugins.tagline: Color token generator with automatic shade scales and Figma Variables export

plugins.name: Figma to Creatopy
plugins.description:
Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy‚Äîwork faster, collaborate better, and scale effortlessly.


Key Features


  1. Quick Import:

Easily import selected Figma frames into a project and folder of your choice in Creatopy.

  1. Import as single design or set: Set import is available for multiple identical frames provided the layers have the same name and are of the same type.
  2. Smart Layer Mapping: Figma layers (images, text, shapes) are auto-converted to matching Creatopy layers.
  3. Editable Elements: All imported elements stay editable‚Äîtweak designs, animate, or scale with automation.
  4. Preserved Structure: Figma‚Äôs nested groups stay intact, keeping your design organized and easy to navigate.



Current Version Limitations


  1. Frame properties are removed; frames become groups.
  2. No support for auto layout and constraints.
  3. Limited support for blend modes, strokes, effects, gradients, and corner radius.



Streamline your process. Scale your creativity. Try ‚ÄúFigma to Creatopy‚Äù and design smarter from the start.
plugins.tagline: Boost your workflow by importing Figma designs directly into Creatopy.

- The plugin now considers only the first visible fill property of each layer

plugins.name: Symplr.io - Figma to a working App in minutes
plugins.description:
What is Symplr.io?

Symplr.io is a cutting-edge low-code platform designed to empower anyone to create production-ready web and mobile apps effortlessly. Symplr.io allows users to rapidly compose innovative apps covering a broad range of domains such as fintech, open finance & e-commerce.


What Does This Plugin Do?

The Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin bridges the gap between design and development. It enables the users to convert a Figma design into a working app by seamlessly importing the Figma design into the Symplr Studio. The users can extend the imported app by adding API workflows and business logic within Symplr Studio.


What Can You Do in Symplr.io Studio?

  1. Add Logic & APIs: Use Symplr's intuitive low-code tools to define business logic and integrate APIs, leveraging the Arazzo Workflow Specification for seamless API integrations.
  2. Build, Test, & Deploy: Build your app, test its functionality, and deploy the code directly to your GitHub repository.


How to Use the Plugin

  1. Install the Symplr.io - Figma to Functional App Instantly plugin from the Figma Marketplace.
  2. Using the plugin interface, tag your Figma components to match Symplr‚Äôs widget library.
  3. Import your tagged Figma designs to Symplr.io.
  4. View your auto-generated app.
  5. Enhance your app by adding business logic and APIs (Arazzo specification-based workflows).
  6. Build and test your mobile app directly from Symplr.io.

Note: Currently, Symplr.io supports mobile apps with React Native.


Create your next mobile app seamlessly, from design to deployment, with Symplr.io! (https://studio.symplr.io)
plugins.tagline: Instantly convert Figma designs into production-ready, mobile apps.

plugins.name: FigmaUser
plugins.description: The FigmaUser plugin is designed for users who need to extract more data from their Figma files when using the BlocksIn App. With this plugin, you can easily get user IDs to create Figma Activity Graphs and reports. This enhances the collaboration experience by unlocking additional insights from your Figma projects. Simple and effective, FigmaUser is a great tool for teams looking to maximize their use of Figma. More info about BlocksIn App: https://blocksin.com/
plugins.tagline: Get Figma User Id
